ref: 2032 *uddhvalati ʻ goes astray ʼ. 2. *uddhvālayati ʻ leads astray ʼ. 3. *uddhvāla -- . [Prob. cmpd. of hválati ʻ goes astray ʼ ŚBr. = hváratē RV., hvālayati ʻ shakes ʼ Bhaṭṭ.; but poss., in view of forms with ūḍh -- (if < *udzdh -- ), cmpd. of *dhvalati = dhvárati ʻ bends, makes fall ʼ Dhātup., 3 pl. aor. mid. ádhūrṣata RV.: √hval (√hvr̥) or √dhvr̥]
P. uddhlaṇā ʻ to elope (of a married woman) ʼ;
Bhoj. uṛharī ʻ a woman who has eloped or been carried off forcibly ʼ;
Bhoj. uṛharī ʻ a woman who has eloped or been carried off forcibly ʼ;
H. udhalnā ʻ to elope, be seduced, be full of lust, be ruined, be squandered ʼ,
G. udhaḷvũ ʻ to run away with a man other than one's husband, run away wildly ʼ;
M. udhaḷṇẽ ʻ to run away wildly or in every direction, run off (of a tenant), fail (of a crop) ʼ.
